attributes.action: Change the law so all drive thru's print car registrations on it's packaging.
attributes.additional_details: There has previously already been a petition rejected by the Government in April 2016 which asked for car registrations to be printed onto the packaging of fast food. This petition was rejected by the Government on the basis that 'UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for this issue'. They stated that it would be a decision for fast food establishments and that for this change to take place, the law would have to be changed.
attributes.background: Amend the law so that it requires any UK restaurant with a drive thru facility to print the car registration of the customer on it’s fast food packaging.
